block.p: Amanda Rahn Vineyard, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Gordon C. Vineyard of Chestnut Hill, Mass., was married yesterday to Kevin Patrick Kavanagh, a son of Mr. and Mrs. John P. Kavanagh of Grasmere, Staten Island. The Rev. Joseph A. Bassett, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the First Church in Chestnut Hill.
The couple received M.B.A. degrees from Dartmouth College.

Amanda Rahn Vineyard, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Gordon C. Vineyard of Chestnut Hill, Mass., was married yesterday to Kevin Patrick Kavanagh, a son of Mr. and Mrs. John P. Kavanagh of Grasmere, Staten Island. The Rev. Joseph A. Bassett, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony at the First Church in Chestnut Hill.
The couple received M.B.A. degrees from Dartmouth College.

Mrs. Kavanagh, 28, is the director of strategic partnerships at ePod.com, an online marketing and e-commerce company in Manhattan. She graduated cum laude from Trinity College in Hartford. Her father, who is retired, was the chief executive officer of Harvard Vanguard Medical Associates, a health maintenance organization in Boston, and an associate professor of surgery at Harvard University in Cambridge, Mass. Her mother, Phyllis Vineyard, is the chairwoman of the ethics committee at Goddard House Nursing Home and Skills Rehabilitation Center in Jamaica Plain, Mass.

Mr. Kavanagh, 32, is a trader at Taconic Capital Advisors, a hedge fund in Manhattan. He graduated from Princeton. His mother, Eileen Kavanagh, is the assistant to the editor of The Staten Island Advance. His father retired as a command chief in Brooklyn for the Transit Police Department.
